PROCLAMATION OF A NUNCUPATIVE WILL
(1) If the deceased made a nuncupative will and there is a document attesting thereto, signed by witnesses in their own hand, the court shall declare the content of such a document in accordance with the provisions that apply to the proclamation of a written will.
(2) If such a document does not exist, the witnesses in front of whom the nuncupative will was made shall be examined thereon separately, particularly regarding the circumstances on which the validity of the will depends; the minutes of the examination of the witnesses shall then be declared in accordance with the provisions that apply to the proclamation of a written will.
